text:
e="preserve">Victor Mizzy (January 9, 1916 – October 17, 2009) was an American composer. His best-known works are the themes to the 1960s television sitcoms "Green Acres" and "The Addams Family". Mizzy also wrote top-20 songs from the 1930s to 1940s. He was born in New York City.
Mizzy died at his home in Bel Air, California, on October 17, 2009, aged 93.
